How can I decode a raw transaction using the Verus command-line interface?

You can decode a raw transaction using the `decoderawtransaction` command in the Verus command-line interface, followed by the hex string of the transaction. The format of the command is:
```
verus decoderawtransaction "hexstring"
```
Replace "hexstring" with the actual hex string of the transaction you want to decode.

Examples:
> verus decoderawtransaction "hexstring"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "decoderawtransaction", "params": ["hexstring"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
